page.description: Toggles the state of the Application Server (e.g. starts a stopped server, stops a running server)
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = httpd_server_toggle([L confirm [,L raise_errors [,L use_registry_settings ]]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: .T. = Server successfully started or stopped. .F. = Server not started or stopped.

argument.name: confirm
argument.description: Optional. Default = .F. (FALSE). If .T. (TRUE) prompts the user to confirm the toggle.

argument.name: raise_errors
argument.description: Optional. Default = .F. (FALSE). If .T. (TRUE) raises error messages in error boxes.

argument.name: use_registry_settings
argument.description: Optional. Default = .F. (FALSE). If .T. (TRUE) uses user preferences. If .T. (TRUE), the user can choose to suppress the automatic confirmation dialog that appears.

page.discussion: The HTTPD_SERVER_TOGGLE() function toggles the state of the Application Server (starts a stopped server, stops a running server).
